elements.title: women's 400 metres hurdles at the 2024 European Athletics Championships (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Femke Bol won the women's 400 metres hurdles at the 2024 European Athletics Championships (medallists pictured) in a championship record of 52.49 seconds?

elements.title: Steve Elcock (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Steve Elcock's Symphony No. 6 is dedicated to "the everlasting execration of self-serving politicians, the obscenely rich and the system that allows them to remain so"?

elements.title: Breaking Through (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that to embody her role as a short-track speed skater in the movie Breaking Through, actress Meng Meiqi inserted a rock into one of her ice skates to feel real pain?

elements.title: James A. Glover (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that British physician James A. Glover found that "spacing-out" beds prevented epidemics of meningitis in the military during World War I?

elements.title: Braver Angels (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a co-founder of Braver Angels designed their Red/Blue political depolarization workshops based on couples therapy?

elements.title: 1969 leadership election (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the 1969 leadership election for the Progressive Conservative Party of New Brunswick was blacklisted by the American Federation of Musicians because one of the candidates was indebted to them?

elements.title: Judy Kellogg Markowsky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that American ornithologist Judy Kellogg Markowsky died after disappearing in the river that she worked to protect during her life?

elements.title: third Josef Hoop cabinet (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the third Josef Hoop cabinet survived an attempted coup from a domestic Nazi party?

elements.title: Anna Smith Spark (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that author Anna Smith Spark is also known as the "Queen of Grimdark"?
